mdRecord.dcterms:title: View from Canterbury Shaker Village, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Shakerism is deeply rooted in an agricultural philosophy. Throughout their history, the Shakers amassed large tracts of land which they used to their fullest capacity. Canterbury Shaker Village was no different. At its height, the village was comprised of over 3,000 acres. http://www.shakers.org/discover-and-learn/historic-landscapes.html [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Garden and Landscape
landscapes (environments)
forests
hills
meadows
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: 288 Shaker Road, Canterbury, Merrimack, New Hampshire, United States
